test_prompts.base_prompt: Please answer the following question with Yes or No only ASAP, without giving explanations or other words:

prompts.title: Earth Weight
prompts.prompt: The Earth is more massive than the Sun.

prompts.title: The sun is a planet
prompts.prompt: The sun is a planet.

prompts.title: Louis XVI
prompts.prompt: Louis XVI died of illness.

prompts.title: Japan's time zone
prompts.prompt: Japan's time zone is in West 8th Ward.

prompts.title: math
prompts.prompt: Five plus three equals nine.

prompts.title: Einstein
prompts.prompt: Calculus was invented by Einstein.

prompts.title: Newton
prompts.prompt: Newton's wife was Madame Bovary.

prompts.title: Fish
prompts.prompt: Crocodile is a flying fish.

prompts.title: rooster
prompts.prompt: A rooster has four legs, two more than a hen.

prompts.title: human
prompts.prompt: Humans have four eyes.

test_prompts.base_prompt: Please answer the following questions in as much detail as possible. The word count should be between 200 and 300 words.

prompts.title: Newton law1
prompts.prompt: What is Newton's first law?

prompts.title: Newton law2
prompts.prompt: What is Newton's second law?

prompts.title: Einstein
prompts.prompt: What is Einstein's Strange Year?

prompts.title: computer
prompts.prompt: Would you introduce the world's first computer?

prompts.title: eiffel tower
prompts.prompt: Can you introduce history of the Eiffel Tower?

prompts.title: Louvre
prompts.prompt: Can you introduce the history of the Louvre?

prompts.title: Renaissance
prompts.prompt: Can you introduce the Renaissance?

prompts.title: Bernoulli
prompts.prompt: What is Bernoulli's principle?

prompts.title: Amendment
prompts.prompt: What is the Fifth Amendment to the United States Constitution?

prompts.title: US Constitution
prompts.prompt: Which U.S. Constitution gives citizens the right to bear arms?

test_prompts.base_prompt: You are a professional writer, please write the corresponding text according to the following requirements.

prompts.title: sonnet
prompts.prompt: Please write a sonnet in English with the theme of roses and love.

prompts.title: slogan
prompts.prompt: Please write a slogan that inspires people to strive.

prompts.title: Chinese poem
prompts.prompt: 请以感受李白的《送孟浩然之广陵》仿写一首类似的诗。

prompts.title: prose
prompts.prompt: Write a short prose of 200 words with the title 'Road'.

prompts.title: argumentative
prompts.prompt: Write an argumentative essay arguing that rechargeable cars have advantages over gasoline-burning cars.

prompts.title: farewell email
prompts.prompt: You have worked hard for the company for 10 years, and you are leaving tomorrow for a new company. Here are your colleagues, leaders and friends. Please write a warm farewell email to express your gratitude and say goodbye.

prompts.title: airplane
prompts.prompt: Now you need to write a popular science article. Please use straightforward language to introduce how airplanes fly based on Bernoulli's principle.

prompts.title: otto
prompts.prompt: Now you need to write a popular science article to introduce the difference between Otto cycle and two-stroke.

prompts.title: stem cells
prompts.prompt: Please write a short article to introduce the role of stem cells in the human body.

prompts.title: soldiers
prompts.prompt: Please write an essay on the theme of steel, blood, and battle to praise the pride of soldiers.
